sentences: Santi White (born September 25, 1976), known professionally as Santigold (formerly Santogold), is an American singer and songwriter.
Her debut studio album, Santogold (2008), received critical acclaim.
Her second album, Master of My Make-Believe, was released in 2012.
She released her third album, 99¢, in 2016, and her second mixtape, I Don't Want: The Gold Fire Sessions, in 2018.
She released her third album, 99¢, in 2016, and her second mixtape, I Don't Want: The Gold Fire Sessions, in 2018.
Santi White was born on September 25, 1976 in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania.
She obtained her pseudonym in the 1990s after a friend gave it to her as a nickname.
She was the singer of Philadelphia-based punk rock band Stiffed, which released the albums Sex Sells (2003) and Burned Again (2005).
She was the singer of Philadelphia-based punk rock band Stiffed, which released the albums Sex Sells (2003) and Burned Again (2005).
White is married to Trevor Andrew, with whom she has a son named Radek, born in 2014.

She announced the follow-up to Santogold would be out in spring 2012.

In 2013, she recorded the song "Girls" for the soundtrack of the series of the same name.
In June 2015, she contributed the song "Radio" to the soundtrack of the film Paper Towns.

In February 2016, Santigold released an interactive music video for the song, which allowed viewers to insert themselves in the video, furthering the song's message about self-absorption and promotion in the social media age.
99¢, her third album, was out in February 2016 on Atlantic.

The singer has also stated that she is inspired by 1980s pop music, feeling that it "had a depth to it", and that she hopes to "bring back some more good pop songs."
Santogold was critically acclaimed by both Entertainment Weekly and Spin, while "L.E.S. Artistes" made the number 2 position on Rolling Stone's "Singles of the Year" list.

sentences: "Big Mouth", the first track and video from the album was issued in late January as a free download.
In February, an animated video for "Disparate Youth" was uploaded to her official YouTube channel.
Master of My Make-Believe was released in late April to critical acclaim.
"Disparate Youth" was featured in a December 2012 advertisement for the 2013 Honda Civic and a piano version of the song was used in a 2012-13 ad for Direct Line insurance.
In May and June, she headlined her own US shows before a summer European tour.

On August 15, 2012, she performed on the deck of the USS Intrepid as part of "Stephest Colbchella '012: Rocktaugustfest" on The Colbert Report, and on May 9, 2013, she appeared as herself on The Office episode "A.A.R.M..
In November, "Can't Get Enough of Myself", the first single of her forthcoming new album 99¢, was released.
A second track, "Who Be Lovin Me" which featured iLoveMakonnen, was made available in December.
Santigold then went on tour in the USA from March until May.
Santigold released the dancehall-inspired mixtape I Don't Want: The Gold Fire Sessions on July 27, 2018, after announcing it the day before.
